channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-5297] Hive does not honor type for partition columns
item.description:
Hive does not consider the type of the partition column while writing partitions. Consider for example the query:

create table tab1 (id1 int, id2 string) PARTITIONED BY(month string,day int) row format delimited fields terminated by ',';
alter table tab1 add partition (month='June', day='second');

Hive accepts this query. However if you try to select from this table and insert into another expecting schema match, it will insert nulls instead. We should throw an exception on such user error at the time the partition addition/load happens.
item.summary: Hive does not honor type for partition columns

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

This issue has been fixed and released as part of 0.12 release. If you find further issues, please create a new jira and link it to this one.

Doc note: This added hive.typecheck.on.insert to HiveConf.java, so it needs to be documented in the wiki. (HIVE-10307 extends the parameter in release 1.2.0.)

  • Configuration Properties – Query and DDL Execution

ctang.ma documented this in the wiki, so I'm removing the TODOC12 label.

  • Configuration Properties – hive.typecheck.on.insert
  • DML – Inserting data into Hive Tables from queries
